intro: Euphrasia gibbsiae subsp. gibbsiae, commonly known as Gibbs' eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers well-drained conditions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
